member.name: T:MongoDbGenericRepository.BaseMongoRepository
member.summary: The base Repository, it is meant to be inherited from by your custom custom MongoRepository implementation. Its constructor must be given a connection string and a database name.

member.summary: The document constructor

member.summary: The version of the schema of the document

member.name: T:MongoDbGenericRepository.Models.IDocument`1
member.summary: This class represents a basic document that can be stored in MongoDb. Your document must implement this class in order for the MongoDbRepository to handle them.

member.name: P:MongoDbGenericRepository.Models.IDocument`1.Id
member.summary: The Primary Key, which must be decorated with the [BsonId] attribute if you want the MongoDb C# driver to consider it to be the document ID.

member.name: P:MongoDbGenericRepository.Models.IDocument`1.Version
member.summary: A version number, to indicate the version of the schema.

member.name: T:MongoDbGenericRepository.Models.IDocument
member.summary: This class represents a basic document that can be stored in MongoDb. Your document must implement this class in order for the MongoDbRepository to handle them.

member.name: T:MongoDbGenericRepository.Models.IPartitionedDocument
member.summary: This class represents a document that can be inserted in a collection that can be partitioned. The partition key allows for the creation of different collections having the same document schema. This can be useful if you are planning to build a Software as a Service (SaaS) Platform, or if you want to reduce indexing. You could for example insert Logs in different collections based on the week and year they where created, or their Log category/source.

member.name: P:MongoDbGenericRepository.Models.IPartitionedDocument.PartitionKey
member.summary: The partition key used to partition your collection.

member.name: T:MongoDbGenericRepository.Models.PartitionedDocument
member.summary: This class represents a document that can be inserted in a collection that can be partitioned. The partition key allows for the creation of different collections having the same document schema. This can be useful if you are planning to build a Software as a Service (SaaS) Platform, or if you want to reduce indexing. You could for example insert Logs in different collections based on the week and year they where created, or their Log category/source.

member.name: M:MongoDbGenericRepository.Models.PartitionedDocument.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: The constructor, it needs a partition key.

member.name: P:MongoDbGenericRepository.Models.PartitionedDocument.PartitionKey
member.summary: The name of the property used for partitioning the collection This will not be inserted into the collection. This partition key will be prepended to the collection name to create a new collection.

member.name: M:MongoDbGenericRepository.ReadOnlyMongoRepository.HandlePartitioned``2(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a collections for a potentially partitioned document type.
member.typeparam: The type of the primary key.

member.name: T:MongoDbGenericRepository.Utils.Vocabularies
member.summary: Container for registered Vocabularies. At present, only a single vocabulary is supported: Default.

member.name: P:MongoDbGenericRepository.Utils.Vocabularies.Default
member.summary: The default vocabulary used for singular/plural irregularities. Rules can be added to this vocabulary and will be picked up by called to Singularize() and Pluralize(). At this time, multiple vocabularies and removing existing rules are not supported.

member.name: T:MongoDbGenericRepository.Utils.Vocabulary
member.summary: A container for exceptions to simple pluralization/singularization rules. Vocabularies.Default contains an extensive list of rules for US English. At this time, multiple vocabularies and removing existing rules are not supported.

member.name: M:MongoDbGenericRepository.Utils.Vocabulary.AddIrregular(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a word to the vocabulary which cannot easily be pluralized/singularized by RegEx, e.g. "person" and "people".
member.param: The singular form of the irregular word, e.g. "person".
The plural form of the irregular word, e.g. "people".
True to match these words on their own as well as at the end of longer words. False, otherwise.

member.name: M:MongoDbGenericRepository.Utils.Vocabulary.AddUncountable(System.String)
member.summary: Adds an uncountable word to the vocabulary, e.g. "fish". Will be ignored when plurality is changed.
member.param: Word to be added to the list of uncountables.

member.name: M:MongoDbGenericRepository.Utils.Vocabulary.AddPlural(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a rule to the vocabulary that does not follow trivial rules for pluralization, e.g. "bus" -> "buses"
member.param: RegEx to be matched, case insensitive, e.g. "(bus)es$"

member.name: M:MongoDbGenericRepository.Utils.Vocabulary.AddSingular(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a rule to the vocabulary that does not follow trivial rules for singularization, e.g. "vertices/indices -> "vertex/index"
member.param: RegEx to be matched, case insensitive, e.g. ""(vert|ind)ices$""

member.name: M:MongoDbGenericRepository.Utils.Vocabulary.Pluralize(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Pluralizes the provided input considering irregular words
member.param: Normally you call Pluralize on singular words; but if you're unsure call it with false

member.name: M:MongoDbGenericRepository.Utils.Vocabulary.Singularize(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Singularizes the provided input considering irregular words
member.param: Normally you call Singularize on plural words; but if you're unsure call it with false

member.name: T:MongoDbGenericRepository.Utils.InflectorExtensions
member.summary: Inflector extensions

member.name: M:MongoDbGenericRepository.Utils.InflectorExtensions.Pluralize(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Pluralizes the provided input considering irregular words
member.param: Normally you call Pluralize on singular words; but if you're unsure call it with false

member.name: M:MongoDbGenericRepository.Utils.InflectorExtensions.Singularize(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Singularizes the provided input considering irregular words
member.param: Normally you call Singularize on plural words; but if you're unsure call it with false

member.name: M:MongoDbGenericRepository.Utils.InflectorExtensions.Pascalize(System.String)
member.summary: By default, pascalize converts strings to UpperCamelCase also removing underscores

member.name: M:MongoDbGenericRepository.Utils.InflectorExtensions.Camelize(System.String)
member.summary: Same as Pascalize except that the first character is lower case

member.name: M:MongoDbGenericRepository.Utils.InflectorExtensions.Underscore(System.String)
member.summary: Separates the input words with underscore

member.name: M:MongoDbGenericRepository.Utils.InflectorExtensions.Dasherize(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces underscores with dashes in the string

member.name: M:MongoDbGenericRepository.Utils.InflectorExtensions.Hyphenate(System.String)
member.summary: Replaces underscores with hyphens in the string

member.name: T:MongoDbGenericRepository.Utils.RandomExtensions
member.summary: Extensions for the random number generator

member.name: M:MongoDbGenericRepository.Utils.RandomExtensions.NextLong(System.Random,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns a random long from min (inclusive) to max (exclusive)
member.param: The exclusive maximum bound. Must be greater than min

member.name: M:MongoDbGenericRepository.Utils.RandomExtensions.NextLong(System.Random,System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns a random long from 0 (inclusive) to max (exclusive)
member.param: The exclusive maximum bound. Must be greater than 0

member.name: M:MongoDbGenericRepository.Utils.RandomExtensions.NextLong(System.Random)
member.summary: Returns a random long over all possible values of long (except long.MaxValue, similar to random.Next())
